intro: Vochysia aurantiaca, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Chrysobalanaceae and is characterized by its showy, orange-yellow flowers that bloom in pendulous clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. It produces small, round fruits that enclose a single seed. Vochysia aurantiaca is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
